Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a plant with water and light to show how it grows.
The student can draw a plant without water to show what happens.
The student can draw a plant without light to show what happens.
The student can include details in their drawing to show the differences between plants that have water and light and those that do not.
The student can use patterns from their observations to show that plants need water and light to live and grow.
